description:
​​


We’re passionate about really ‘living’ our People Vision to create an environment which inspires the best and the brightest, where high performance is the norm and where teams have a shared sense of future success. 

Every year hundreds of our staff volunteer and participate in the International Women’s day Fun Run

What it feels like to work here

There’s a special ‘vibe’ at RACQ, a palpable mood that comes from our sense of pride in serving Queensland members for more than 110 years.

The many generations of staff, past and present, are deeply proud of RACQ’s heritage and very protective of its future. That’s why we’re firmly focussed on our purpose to make a positive difference to the lives of our members now and into the future.

There’s a lot happening here

In our business

We’re bursting at the seams with opportunities for staff to make a difference and get involved. Across our business RACQ employees are invited to be actively involved in contributing ideas to help shape our strategy and culture.

This video captures the story from members of our team who took the lead in creating our values. 


We’ve recently launched an innovation space where all staff have an opportunity to contribute to business ideas and identify solutions. It’s called basecamp and it’s creating quite a buzz!


Another initiative which is strengthening our collaborative culture is the Business Connectors, a team of individuals from across the business who are proactively identifying collaboration gaps and suggesting ways to fill them.

​

 


In our community

When it comes to digging in and giving back there’s plenty on offer. Everything from workplace volunteering and workplace giving to helping Western Queensland families as part of our RACQ Foundation or participating in our community-led and supported events.


 
Our team of staff volunteers at Charleville

What else you can expect  

So now you know a little more about what empowers us, here’s what else we have to offer.

We live Diversity and Inclusion 

With more than 2200 employees spread right across Queensland, by nature we are a vibrant and diverse workforce. We bring with us a breadth of backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences and embrace an organisational culture and workplace that values diversity and inclusion across every aspect of our business.

  • 60% female employees
  • 30% females on our Boards
  • Our commitment - improving gender balance at senior levels

Flexibility

What we have now: part-time roles, flexible work hours, purchased annual leave, 12 weeks paid parental leave (after a qualifying period and also available at half pay) and time in lieu to name a few.

Where we’re going: Flexible working options for all employees regardless of gender, family responsibilities or career stage (in place within 2 years).


Wellbeing

With members of our team working in dangerous road environments, we’re extra careful when it comes to the health, safety and wellbeing of our entire team.

Our health and wellbeing programs are many and varied, providing affirmative, preventative and informative activities and opportunities to nurture our physical and mental wellbeing.

Activities offered include:

  • Fitness, yoga, meditation
  • Healthy eating
  • Ergonomics and safety training
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Health insurance staff discounts
  • Red Cross donations, free flu shots 

Experience this:

We have so many staff benefits, it’s hard to know where to start, or stop.

  • Career development – Leadership programs, development programs, Women in Leadership, training and development, professional mentoring, executive coaching and mentoring,
  • Bank – staff discounts
  • Insurance – staff and family discounts
  • Roadside and home – staff and family discounts
  • Travel and lifestyle – staff and family discounts
  • Salary sacrificing – novated lease
  • Leave Benefits – a breadth on offer such as 12 weeks paid parental leave (also available at half pay)
  • Corporate partnerships – to whet your appetite this includes resorts, theme parks, movie tickets, concerts, experiences, furniture, jewellery, home decorations and furnishings, dry cleaning, cosmetics and so much more.

Each year our long-serving employees, past and present, are invited to a Milestones lunch event to celebrate their service to members ​
